TEXT:
Admission Date: [**2151-7-16**] Service: MICU
HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: 55yo male with history of COPD presents with 3 days of worsening shortness of breath. Home O2 saturation 88%. Productive cough with green sputum.
MEDICATIONS ON ADMISSION: Albuterol Inhaler, Lisinopril.
PLAN: Admit to MICU. Start IV Steroids (Solu-Medrol). Start Levofloxacin for suspected pneumonia. Monitor O2.

Date: [**2151-7-20**]
RADIOLOGIC STUDIES: Chest CT performed.
FINDINGS: Bilateral upper lobe cavitary lesions observed.
IMPRESSION: Findings concerning for infectious process, rule out Tuberculosis (TB). Moderate left pleural effusion also noted.
RECOMMENDATION: ID Consult and Sputum cultures.

Admission Date: [**2151-7-16**] Discharge Date: [**2151-8-4**]
HOSPITAL COURSE: Patient treated for severe COPD exacerbation and pneumonia.
TB WORKUP: Sputum smears negative x3. TB ruled out.
PROCEDURES: Thoracentesis performed on left pleural effusion, fluid analysis benign.
DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS:
1. Prednisone taper.
2. Levaquin to complete 7 day course.
3. Albuterol q4h.
DISCHARGE CONDITION: Stable on room air. Follow up with Pulmonology in 2 weeks.
